sidebar:
## Sidebar (Virtual Lab Interface)

A compact vertical sidebar on the left side of the screen serves as the main navigation panel. It includes:

### Top Section
- Shows the current navigation path (e.g., `Virtual Lab > Test 2`).

### Main Area
- Displays the current virtual lab title.
- Button for accessing **Documentation**.
- Optional buttons based on context, such as:
  - **About the Platform**
  - **Legal Information**

### Bottom Section
- **Home**: Returns to `/app/virtual-lab/`
- **Help**: General and legal info
- **User Account**: Access to profile and logout

The sidebar is icon-driven and minimal to ensure a clean interface.
general:
## General Overview

A project management platform for data science and research teams. It features:
- A dark blue professional interface with sidebar navigation
- Tools for project organization, team management, and resource tracking
- Multi-project support with role-based access and credit-based resource allocation
- Areas for experimentation, analysis, and documentation

Designed to support simulations, research workflows, and collaborative work across the project lifecycle.
chat:
## AI Chat

A collapsible tab on the right provides access to the AI assistant. It can help users navigate the platform and access tools contextual to their tasks.
page_selection:
## Page Navigation Sidebar

Visible on all pages except **Explore**. This larger sidebar (to the right of the main one) allows navigation between:
- Home
- Library
- Team
- Activity
- Notebooks
- Explore
- Build
- Experiment
- Admin
home:
## Home Page

The project dashboard includes:
- Project title and editable description (top left)
- Metadata: creation date, admin info, credit balance
- Team collaboration section with visible avatars
- Blue gradient interface with aerial imagery
- Edit button in the top right to update project details
library:
## Library Page

Displays saved project entities across three tabs:
- **Experimental Data**
- **Models**
- **Simulations**
project_team:
## Project Team Page

Displays all members in the project. Admins can add or remove team members.
activity:
## Activity Page

Shows recent project activities in a table format. The default tab is **[TAB_NAME]**, with additional tabs:
- [TAB_1]
- [TAB_2]
- [TAB_3]

If no activity is found, a placeholder message is shown. Columns include:
- Scale
- Use Case
- Activity
- Name
- Status
- Date
- Actions

Designed for neuroscience simulation tracking in a scientific computing environment.
notebooks:
## Notebooks Page

Scientific data management for computational neuroscience. Features:

### Tabs
- **[PRIMARY_TAB]** (default)
- **[SECONDARY_TAB]**

### Interface
- Search bar and filtering tools ([N] active columns)
- Sortable table columns

### Table Columns
- Name
- Description
- Object of Interest (e.g., [OBJECT_TYPE], [OBJECT_SUBTYPE])
- Scale (typically [SCALE_TYPE])
- Authors
- Creation Date

### Research Areas
- [RESEARCH_AREA_1]
- [RESEARCH_AREA_2]
- [RESEARCH_AREA_3]
- [RESEARCH_AREA_4]

Clean, professional UI with chronological sorting.
explore:
## Explore Section

A 3D brain atlas interface focused on [BRAIN_REGION], with no right-side page navigation sidebar. Features:

### Left Panel
- Hierarchical region selector (e.g., [REGION_1], [REGION_2], [REGION_3])
- Search for brain regions

### Main View
- Neuron count: ~[COUNT] million
- Toggle: **Count** vs **Density**
- [TYPE_LIST] listed with neuron counts

### Right Panel
- 3D visualization: [HIGHLIGHTED_REGION] highlighted in [COLOR]
- Toggle: **Experimental Data** / **Model Data**

### Bottom Section
- Data records:
  - [DATA_TYPE_1]
  - [DATA_TYPE_2], [DATA_TYPE_3], [DATA_TYPE_4]
explore-morphology:
## Explore Morphology List Page

**Left Navigation Panel:**
- Hierarchical brain region selector with categories like "[BRAIN_REGION_1]," "[BRAIN_REGION_2]," "[BRAIN_REGION_3]," and subcategories including "[SUB_REGION_1]" and "[SUB_REGION_2]"

**Main Content Area:**
- Shows results "[X] of [TOTAL]" entries in the morphology section
- Data table with columns for Preview (neuron morphology diagrams), Brain region, M-type, Name, Species, Contributors, and Registration date
- Each row displays neuron reconstructions as blue branching structures with red endpoints
- Entries show brain regions like "[BRAIN_REGION_NAME_1]" and "[BRAIN_REGION_NAME_2]"
- All specimens from "[SPECIES_NAME]" species
- Data contributed by "[INSTITUTION_NAME]"
- Registration dates shown as "[DATE_FORMAT]"

**Top Tabs:**
- Multiple sections including "[DATA_TYPE_1]," "[DATA_TYPE_2]," "[DATA_TYPE_3]," "[DATA_TYPE_4]," and "[DATA_TYPE_5]"

**Data Table Fields:**
- Preview: [NEURON_DIAGRAM]
- Brain region: [REGION_IDENTIFIER]
- M-type: [MORPHOLOGY_TYPE]
- Name: [SPECIMEN_ID]
- Species: [ORGANISM_NAME]
- Contributors: [RESEARCH_GROUP]
- Registration date: [TIMESTAMP]
explore-morphology-details:
## Morphology Details Page

**Left Sidebar Navigation:**
- Header: "Brain region" with brain icon
- Search field: "Search region..."
- Hierarchical menu showing brain anatomical structures:
  - Basic cell groups and regions (expandable)
  - Brain stem (expandable, highlighted)
  - Cerebellum (expandable)
  - Cerebrum (expandable)
    - Cerebral cortex (expandable)
    - Cerebral nuclei (expandable)

**Main Content Area:**
- Header Section:
  - Navigation back arrow
  - Dataset name: [DATASET_ID]_with_contour
  - Action buttons: Copy ID, Save to library, Download

- Metadata Panel:
  - Description: References a morphological reconstruction study
  - Brain Region: [REGION_NAME]
  - Species: [SPECIES_NAME]
  - License: [LICENSE_TYPE]
  - Contributors: [CONTRIBUTOR_NAME]
  - Registration Date: [DATE]
  - M-Type: [CELL_TYPE]

- Visualization Area:
  - Large interactive viewer showing neural reconstruction
  - 3D/2D representation of branching neural structures
  - Color-coded segments (purple, blue, red lines)
  - Control elements: Settings, zoom controls
  - Navigation controls with colored indicators (Y, Z, X axes)
  - Scale bar showing measurements ([UNIT_1], [UNIT_2], [UNIT_3] units)
explore-electrophysiology:
## Electrophysiology List Page

**Left Sidebar:**
- 'Brain region' title with search box 'Search region...'
- Hierarchical navigation tree including 'Brain stem' (highlighted/selected), 'Cerebellum', and 'Cerebrum' with expandable subcategories like 'Cerebral cortex' and 'Cerebral nuclei'

**Top Tabs:**
- 'Morphology ([NUMBER])', 'Electrophysiology ([NUMBER])', 'Neuron density ([NUMBER])', 'Bouton density ([NUMBER])', and 'Synapse per connection ([NUMBER])'

**Main Content:**
- 'Results [X] of [Y]' with search bar and Filters button
- Data table with columns: Preview (chart thumbnails), Brain region, E-type, Name, Species, Contributors, and Registration date
- Multiple rows showing brain regions like [REGION_TYPE_1] and [REGION_TYPE_2], with chart previews, alphanumeric identifiers, species names, institutional contributors, and registration dates
explore-electrophysiology-details:
## Electrophysiology Details Page

**Left Sidebar:**
- Hierarchical brain region navigation (Brain stem, Cerebellum, Cerebrum with expandable subsections like Cerebral cortex and Cerebral nuclei)

**Header Information:**
- Dataset identifier: [DATASET_ID]
- Description: Whole cell patch clamp recording from [NEURON_TYPE] in [TISSUE_TYPE]
- Brain region: [BRAIN_REGION_NAME], layer [LAYER_NUMBER]
- Species: [SPECIES_NAME]
- Contributors: [INSTITUTION_NAMES] and [RESEARCHER_NAMES]
- Registration date: [DATE]

**Two Tabs Available:**
- **Overview Tab**: Basic stimulus-response plots with:
  - Top graph: Stimulus protocol over time (step-like voltage commands)
  - Bottom graph: Corresponding neural response traces

- **Interactive Details Tab**: Detailed analysis with:
  - Protocol selection options (Custom/Sweep with [N] available sweeps)
  - Color-coded trace selection palette
  - Side-by-side stimulus and response plots
  - Stimulus shows step voltage protocols
  - Response shows multiple overlaid voltage traces displaying neuronal spiking patterns
explore-neuron-density:
## Neuron Density List Page

**Header Section:**
- Title: "Brain region" with navigation tabs for different data categories (Morphology, Electrophysiology, Neuron density, Bouton density, Synapse per connection)
- Search functionality and filter options

**Left Sidebar:**
- Hierarchical brain region navigator showing:
  - Brain stem
  - Cerebrum (currently selected)
  - Cerebral cortex
  - Cerebral nuclei
  - Basic cell groups and regions

**Main Data Table:**
- Columns:
  - Brain region: Anatomical locations ([REGION_NAME] with sublayers like [SUBLAYER_1], [SUBLAYER_2], [SUBLAYER_3])
  - M-type: Cell morphology types ([MORPHOLOGY_CODE_1], [MORPHOLOGY_CODE_2])
  - E-type: Electrophysiological types
  - Density: Numerical values representing neuron densities
  - N° of measurements: Number of data points
  - Name: Descriptive names for neuron types in specific regions
  - Species: [SPECIES_NAME]
  - Age: [AGE_INFO]
  - Contributors: [CONTRIBUTOR_NAMES]
  - Registration date: [DATE_FORMAT]

- Shows [X] results out of [TOTAL] total entries, with pagination controls
explore-neuron-density-details:
## Neuron Density Details Page

**Left Sidebar:**
- Navigation showing "Brain region" as main category
- Hierarchical menu structure with sections like "Basic cell groups and regions", "Brain stem", "Cerebellum", and "Cerebrum" (currently selected)
- Sub-categories under Cerebrum including "Cerebral cortex" and "Cerebral nuclei"

**Main Content Area:**
- Title: "Neuron density for [NEURON_TYPE] neurons in [BRAIN_REGION]"
- Top action bar with "Copy ID", "Save to library", and "Download" options

**Data Fields:**
- Description: Detailed text about neuron measurement methodology with reference to [REFERENCE_TYPE]
- Contributors: [RESEARCHER_NAME]
- Registration Date: [DATE]
- Brain Region: [SPECIFIC_REGION]
- Species: [SPECIES_NAME]
- M-Type: [MORPHOLOGY_TYPE]
- Age: [AGE_VALUE]
- E-Type: [ELECTRICAL_TYPE]
- Density: [NUMERICAL_VALUE]
- Number of Measurements: [COUNT]
explore-bouton-density:
## Bouton Density List Page

**Header Navigation:**
- Multiple tabs including "Morphology ([NUMBER])", "Electrophysiology ([NUMBER])", "Neuron density ([NUMBER])", "Bouton density ([NUMBER])", and "Synapse per connection ([NUMBER])"

**Left Sidebar:**
- "Brain region" dropdown selector
- Hierarchical tree structure showing:
  - Brain stem
  - Cerebellum
  - Cerebrum (currently selected/highlighted)
  - [CORTEX_TYPE]
  - [NUCLEI_TYPE]

**Main Content Area:**
- Shows "Results [X] of [Y]" at the top
- Data table with columns:
  - Brain region
  - M-type
  - Mean ± STD
  - SEM
  - N° of measurements
  - Species
  - Contributors

**Data Rows:**
- Multiple entries for "[FIELD_NAME]" with various morphological measurements ([MEASUREMENT_TYPE] identifiers)
- Statistical values (means with standard deviations)
- All attributed to [SPECIES_NAME] and [CONTRIBUTOR_NAME]

**Interface Elements:**
- Search functionality
- Filter options ("[X] Filters [Y] Advanced")
- Standard database navigation and sorting controls
explore-bouton-density-details:
## Bouton Density Details Page

**Left Sidebar:**
- Hierarchical brain region navigation menu, including sections like "Brain stem," "Cerebellum," "Cerebrum" with expandable subsections for "Cerebral cortex" and "Cerebral nuclei"

**Main Content:**
- Header: "[MEASUREMENT_TYPE] for [BRAIN_REGION] [NEURON_TYPE] neurons" with action buttons (Copy ID, Save to library, Download)
- Description: "[MEASUREMENT_TYPE] of [BRAIN_AREA], [NEURON_CLASSIFICATION]"

**Metadata Table:**
- Brain Region: [REGION_NAME]
- Species: [SPECIES_NAME]
- License: [LICENSE_INFO]
- Contributors: [RESEARCHER_NAME]
- Registration Date: [DATE]
- M-Type: [MORPHOLOGY_TYPE]
- Age: [AGE_INFO]
- Mean ± STD: [NUMERICAL_VALUE] ± [STANDARD_DEVIATION]
- Weight: [WEIGHT_INFO]
- SEM: [STANDARD_ERROR]
- N° of Measurements: [COUNT]
explore-synapse-per-connection:
## Synapse Per Connection List Page

**Interface Structure:**
- Left sidebar with hierarchical navigation showing brain anatomy regions (Brain stem, Cerebrum with sub-regions like Cerebral cortex, Cerebral nuclei)
- Main data table showing search results

**Data Table Columns:**
- Brain region [from] and [to] - anatomical connectivity data
- Cell type [from] and [to] - cell classification information
- Mean ± STD - statistical measurements
- Species - taxonomic information
- Age - developmental stage data
- Contributors - researcher attribution

**Navigation Elements:**
- Search functionality at the top
- Filter options ("[X] active filters")
- Tab system with sections like "Morphology", "Electrophysiology", "Neuron density", "Bouton density", and "Synapse per connection"
- Results counter showing "[X] of [Y]"

**Data Pattern:**
- [FIELD_ID] entries in region columns
- [CELL_TYPE] classifications
- [NUMERICAL_VALUE ± ERROR] in statistics
- [SPECIES_NAME] in species column
- [CONTRIBUTOR_NAME] in attribution
explore-synapse-per-connection-details:
## Synapse Per Connection Details Page

**Left Navigation Panel:**
- Header showing "Brain region" with search functionality
- Hierarchical navigation tree including:
  - Basic cell groups and regions
  - Brain stem
  - Cerebellum
  - Cerebrum (with sub-items like Cerebral cortex and Cerebral nuclei)

**Main Content Area:**
- Title: Dataset name describing synaptic connections between neural populations
- Action buttons: Copy ID, Save to library, Download options

**Metadata Sections:**
- Description: Brief explanation of dataset parameters
- Contributors: [CONTRIBUTOR_NAME]
- Registration Date: [DATE]
- Brain Region From/To: [FIELD_REFERENCES]
- Species: [SPECIES_NAME]
- License information
- Age and Weight fields
- Cell Type From/To: Both showing [CELL_TYPE]
- Statistical measures: Mean ± STD showing [NUMERICAL_VALUE]
- SEM field

**Right Side:**
- AI Assistant panel toggle
build:
## Build Page

Model selection interface across neuroscience scales. Categories:

### SUBCELLULAR
- Ion Channel *(Coming soon)*
- Metabolism *(Coming soon)*
- NGV Unit *(Coming soon)*

### CELLULAR
- **Single Neuron** *(Available)*: Includes Hodgkin-Huxley models
- Synaptome *(Coming soon)*
- Paired Neurons *(Coming soon)*

### CIRCUIT
- Small Microcircuit *(Coming soon)*
- Microcircuit *(Coming soon)*
- NGV Circuit *(Coming soon)*

### SYSTEM
- Brain Regions *(Coming soon)*
- Brain Systems *(Coming soon)*
- Whole Brain *(Coming soon)*

Only the **Single Neuron** model is currently available.
build-me-model:
## Build ME model Page

This appears to be a web form interface for creating a single neuron model. The page has a clean, minimalist design with the following elements: Header: Title: "Build a new single neuron model" User attribution showing "[USERNAME]" in the top right Date stamp showing "[DATE]" in the top right Form Fields: NAME (required field) Text input field with placeholder text "[your model name]" DESCRIPTION (optional field) Large text area with placeholder text "[your description]" BRAIN REGION (optional field) Dropdown/select field with placeholder text "Select brain region" Action Button: Blue "Start building" button positioned in the bottom right corner The overall layout is spacious with plenty of white space, using a blue color scheme for interactive elements. The form appears to be the initial step in a workflow for creating computational neuron models, likely for neuroscience research or educational purposes.
build-me-model-details:
## Build ME model details Page

 This appears to be a data or model selection interface with the following structure: Header Section: NAME: [placeholder] DESCRIPTION: [placeholder text] Information Grid: BRAIN REGION: [placeholder region name] CREATED BY: [placeholder creator name] CREATED DATE: [placeholder date] M-TYPE: [placeholder value] E-TYPE: [placeholder value] Selection Areas: A section labeled "Select m-model" with what appears to be an empty selection area or dropdown A section labeled "Select e-model" with what appears to be an empty selection area or dropdown The interface has a clean, minimal design with gray text labels and appears to be part of a scientific or research application, possibly related to neural modeling given the terminology like "brain region," "m-model," and "e-model." The layout suggests this is a configuration or setup page where users can view metadata and make selections for different model types.
build-me-model-morphology-selection:
## Build ME model, Morphology selection page 

  This appears to be a brain imaging or neuroimaging analysis interface, likely from a research or clinical platform. Here's what I can see: Left Navigation Panel Title: "Brain region" with a brain icon Search functionality for regions Hierarchical menu structure showing: "Basic cell groups and regions" (expandable) "Brain stem" (expandable with arrow) "Cerebellum" (expandable with arrow) "Cerebrum" (expandable with arrow) Submenu items including "Cerebral cortex" and "Cerebral nuclei" Main Content Area Results counter showing "[NUMBER] of [TOTAL]" results Search bar for resources with search icon Filter options in the top right Data table with columns: Name (showing coded identifiers like "EM__[REGION_CODE]__[ID]") Response (mostly showing validation status messages) Brain region (showing anatomical regions like "Thalamus", "Somatosensory areas") M-type, E-type, Morphology (various technical classifications) Model cumulated score (numerical values) Contributors (showing service account references) Creation date (timestamps from 2025) Visual Elements Some rows contain small chart/graph thumbnails showing what appear to be neural response patterns or waveforms Error icons indicating "Validation result not found" for several entries Blue and white color scheme consistent with scientific/medical interfaces This page allows to view and select morphologies to then selected them to create an ME-model.
build-me-model-e-model-selection:
## Build ME model, electrical model selection page 

  This appears to be a brain imaging analysis interface or database. Here's what I can see: Left Navigation Panel: Header: "Brain region" with a search region dropdown Navigation menu including: Basic cell groups and regions Brain stem Cerebellum Cerebrum (with sub-items like Cerebral cortex and Cerebral nuclei) Main Content Area: Shows "Results [X] of [Y]" at the top Search bar with filter options Data table with columns for: Name (showing entries like "EM__thalmoreticular__[PLACEHOLDER]") Response Brain region (showing regions like "Thalamus", "Somatosensory areas") M-type (showing codes like "UPM_TC", "RL_RC", "L4_DBC") E-type (showing codes like "dNAD_ltb", "cAD_noscltb", "cIR") Morphology (showing codes like "jy[PLACEHOLDER]_B_idA") Model cumulated score (numerical values) Contributors (showing "[PLACEHOLDER]-obp-sing...") Creation date (showing dates like "21.05.2025") Visual Elements: Some rows contain small charts/graphs showing what appear to be neural activity patterns or waveforms Some entries show "Validation result not found" messages The interface uses a blue color scheme. This page allows to select electrical models to then create an ME-model.
build-synaptome:
## Build synpatome Page

 This appears to be a form page for building a new "synaptome model" with the following elements: Header: "Build new synaptome model" Form Fields: NAME (required field indicated by asterisk): Empty text input field with placeholder "Your model name" DESCRIPTION (optional): Large text area with placeholder "Your description" Metadata Section: CREATED BY: Shows "[User Name]" as a placeholder CREATION DATE: Shows "[Date]" as a placeholder Action Button: "Start building" button positioned in the bottom right corner The page has a clean, minimal design with a white background and blue accent colors for the headers and button. The form appears to be the initial step in creating some kind of scientific or technical model, likely related to neural networks or brain connectivity (given the "synaptome" terminology).
experiment:
## Experiment Page

Interface for launching and browsing neural experiments.

### Tabs
- **New Experiment** (active)
- Browse Experiments

### Model Scale Grid
- **Subcellular** (Ion Channel, Metabolism, NGV Unit – *Coming soon*)
- **Cellular**
  - **Single Neuron** *(Available)*: Hodgkin-Huxley models
  - **Synaptome** *(Available)*
  - Paired Neurons *(Coming soon)*
- **Circuit**
  - **Small Microcircuit** *(Available)*
  - Microcircuit, NGV Circuit *(Coming soon)*
- **System** (All *Coming soon*)
  - Brain Regions
  - Brain Systems
  - Whole Brain

### Results Table
- Displays experiment results (e.g., "[X] of [Y]")
- Columns: Name, Morphology, Trace, Validated, Brain Region, M-Type, E-Type, Created By
- Search and filter tools available
admin:
## Admin Page

Project management dashboard with collapsible tabs.

### Costs Tab (Expanded)
- Activity log with columns:
  - Activity (e.g., [ACTIVITY_TYPE])
  - Scale (e.g., [SCALE_TYPE])
  - User
  - Date
  - Credits used
- Shows simulation activity over time
- Top-right stats: Reserved credits and credit balance

### Danger Zone Tab (Expanded)
- Contains a **Delete Project** button (red)
- Minimal layout to focus on the action

### UI Pattern
- Accordion-style tabs with plus/minus icons
- Blue theme, red accents for destructive actions
- Clean tabular data presentation
